summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York requesting specific information from the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death, including ambulance reports and physical descriptions for two individuals named Noel and Thomas. It also lists Bureau of Prisons staff members by shift for voluntary interviews.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner requests his physical description (height and weight) as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner requests his physical description (height and weight) as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, coordinating information requests and interview setups related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Epstein Death Investigation Staff Interviews
events.description: The prosecutor's office is seeking to conduct voluntary interviews with Bureau of Prisons staff who worked shifts on August 9th and 10th, 2019, following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The email is dated August 13, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) is actively seeking specific evidence: ambulance reports and physical descriptions for two individuals named Noel and Thomas.
The U.S. Attorney's Office is planning voluntary interviews with multiple Bureau of Prisons staff members who worked specific shifts around the time of Epstein's death.
The document indicates an immediate and coordinated investigation by federal prosecutors and the medical examiner into the circumstances of Epstein's death in custody.
